losalamos.refs

Classes for parsing, handling and managing references

Description:

The refs module provides classes for parsing, handling and managing references

License:

This software is released under the GNU General Public License v3.0 (GPL-3.0). For details, see: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html

Author:

Iporã Possantti

Contact:

possantti@gmail.com

class losalamos.refs.Ref(entry_type='book', title='The Origin of Species', author='Darwin, C', year='1859', citation_key=None)[source]

Bases: MbaE

The core reference object for managing documents and citations.

Examples:

Here’s how to use the Ref class:

Import Ref

# Import Ref
from losalamos.refs import Ref

Parse Bib Files

# Use built-in static method for parsing `bib` files:
lst_bibs = Ref.parse_bibtex(file_note="./refs.bib")
for bib_dict in lst_bibs:
    print("-------")
    # use method for standardize authors
    bib_dict["author"] = Ref.standard_author(bib_dict=bib_dict)

    # built-in static method for getting in-text citation
    c = Ref.cite_intext(
        bib_dict=bib_dict,
        text_format='md' # markup format
    )
    print(c)
    # built-in static method for getting full citations
    c = Ref.cite_full(
        bib_dict=bib_dict,
        style="apa", # APA format
        text_format='tex',  # markup format
        entry_type=bib_dict["entry_type"]
    )
    print(c)

Instantiate a Reference

# Instantiante a reference
r = Ref(
    entry_type="book",
    title="The Origin of Species",
    author="Charles Darwin",
    year="1859",
    citation_key="darwin1859"
)

Set Reference by Incoming Dict

# (Re)Set reference by incoming dict:
r.set(
    dict_setter={
        "entry_type": "article",
        "title": "Views of Nature"
        "author": "Alexander von Humboldt",
        "year": "1794",
        "citation_key": "humboldt1793",
    }
)

Load Reference from BibTeX File

# Load reference from `bib` file:
# set order=0 for the first reference
r.load_bib(file_note="./beven1989.bib", order=0)

Search/Update bib info via CrossRef API

r.bib_dict = Ref.search_info(
    bib_dict=r.bib_dict, # bib entry
    update=True, # default False
    fields=["doi", "journal", "url", "publisher"],  # Selected fields
    search_query="Beven 1989 changing ideas" # Default is the full-citation
)
__init__(entry_type='book', title='The Origin of Species', author='Darwin, C', year='1859', citation_key=None)[source]

Initialize the Ref object

Parameters:

  • entry_type – reference entry_type in BibTeX convetion (e.g., article, book, etc)

  • title – main title of the reference

  • author – author(s) filename(s)

  • year – year of publication

  • citation_key – citation key of the reference

  • file_note – path to BibTeX file

  • file_note – path to markdown note

  • file_doc – path to pdf document

Entry_type entry_type:

str

load_note()[source]

Loads a note and assigns it to the instance variable.

This method initializes a RefNote object with the instance’s name and alias, sets its file_note attribute, and then calls the load method on the RefNote object.

Save bibliography to bib file (default to bib_file attribute). Ref is expected to hold the bib_dict

  • filename – the name of the .bib file (without extension).

to_note(output_dir, note_template, filename=None, body=None, tags=None, related=None, references=None, pdf_name=None)[source]

Converts the current reference to a note and saves it to a file.

Parameters:

  • output_dir (str) – The directory where the note file will be saved.

  • filename (str) – The name of the note file to be created.

  • body (list or None) – Optional body of the note to include in the note.

  • tags (list or None) – Optional tags associated with the note.

  • related (list or None) – Optional related references.

  • references (list or None) – Optional references to include in the note.

  • pdf_name (str or None) – Optional PDF file name

Returns:

The path to the saved note file.

Return type:

str

static get_citation_keys(lib_folder)[source]

Get the list of citations key from a library folder. The folder is expected to hold references in md files named by the respective citations keys. The “_” is considered a flag for md files not related to the reference.

Parameters:

lib_folder (str) – path to library directory

Returns:

list of names of citation keys

Return type:

list

static bibstr_to_dict(bibtex_str)[source]

Converts a BibTeX string into a dictionary representation.

Parameters:

bibtex_str (str) – The BibTeX string to convert.

Returns:

A dictionary with the BibTeX entry’s type, citation key, and fields.

dict

static parse_bibtex(file_bib)[source]

Parse a bib file and return a list of references as dictionaries.

Parameters:

file_bib – Path to the bib file.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries, each representing a BibTeX bib_dict.

static cite_intext(bib_dict, text_format='plain', embed_link=False)[source]

Format a dictionary of bibliometric parameters into an in-text citation string with optional DOI or URL links.

Parameters:

  • bib_dict – dict A dictionary containing bibliometric parameters from a reference. Expected keys include ‘author’, ‘year’, ‘doi’, and ‘url’.

  • text_format – str The text format for styling (e.g., ‘plain’, ‘html’, ‘md’, ‘tex’).

  • embed_link – bool Whether to embed a DOI or URL link in the citation (default is False).

Returns:

str The formatted in-text citation string.

static cite_full(bib_dict, style='apa', text_format='plain', entry_type='article')[source]

Format a dictionary of bibliometric parameters into a specified citation text_format string and text format.

Parameters:

  • bib_dict – dict A dictionary containing bibliometric parameters from a reference. Expected keys vary depending on the bib_dict entry_type.

  • style – str The citation text_format to format (e.g., ‘apa’, ‘mla’, ‘chicago’, ‘harvard’, ‘vancouver’, ‘abnt’).

  • text_format – str The text format for styling (e.g., ‘plain’, ‘html’, ‘md’, ‘tex’).

  • entry_type – str The entry_type of the BibTeX bib_dict (e.g., ‘article’, ‘book’, ‘inbook’, ‘incollection’, ‘proceedings’, ‘inproceedings’, ‘conference’, ‘phdthesis’, ‘mastersthesis’, ‘techreport’, ‘manual’, ‘unpublished’, ‘misc’).

Returns:

str The formatted citation string.

static bib_to_str(bib_dict, entry_field='entry_type', citation_field='citation_key')[source]

Converts a dictionary representation of a BibTeX entry into a string.

Parameters:

  • bib_dict (dict) – The dictionary containing the BibTeX entry data.

  • entry_field (str) – The key for the entry type in the dictionary.

  • citation_field (str) – The key for the citation key in the dictionary.

Returns:

The BibTeX entry as a formatted string.

Return type:

str

static standard_author(bib_dict)[source]

Formats and standardizes the author names in a BibTeX entry.

Parameters:

bib_dict (dict) – The dictionary containing the BibTeX entry data, expected to have an ‘author’ field.

Returns:

A formatted string of standardized author names.

Return type:

str

static standard_key(bib_dict, conflict_list=None)[source]

Get the standard Citation Key in a BibTeX bib_dict dictionary to LastnameFirstAuthor + Year + x (or a, b, c …)

Parameters:

bib_dict – dict A dictionary containing bibliometric parameters from a reference. Expected key is ‘author’, ‘year’ and ‘title’.

Returns:

str The string with normalized citation key.
